intro: Cyrtandra rhynchotechoides, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant is usually found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streamside areas. It has opposite, ovate leaves with smooth margins and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cyrtandra rhynchotechoides is also known for its role in the unique ecosystems of Hawaii, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
